description: cfhtmltopdf creates PDFs from HTML. It uses the PDF Generator Service Queue that will come shipped with CF11 Enterprise???
name: cfhtmltopdf

params.description: Pathname of a file to contain the PDF output. If you omit the destination attribute, ColdFusion displays the output in the browser.
params.name: destination

params.description: Bottom margin in inches or cm based on unit attribute
params.name: marginBottom

params.description: Top margin in inches or cm based on unit attribute
params.name: marginTop

params.description: Left margin in inches or cm based on unit attribute
params.name: marginLeft

params.description: Right margin in inches or cm based on unit attribute
params.name: marginRight

params.description: Name of an existing variable into which the tag stores the PDF.
params.name: name

params.description: Specifies whether ColdFusion overwrites an existing file. Used in conjunction with the destination attribute.
params.name: overwrite

params.description: Specifies the owner password. Cannot be same as userPassword.
params.name: ownerPassword

params.description: Specifies a user password. Cannot be same as ownerPassword.
params.name: userPassword

params.description: Only valid if pagetype=custom. based on unit attribute
params.name: pageWidth

params.description: Only valid if pagetype=custom. based on unit attribute
params.name: pageHeight

params.description: The filename that appears in the SaveAs dialog when a user saves a PDF file written to the browser.
params.name: saveAsName

params.description: Default unit for the pageHeight, pageWidth, and margin attributes:
params.name: unit

examples.title: Basic Usage
examples.code:
<cfhtmltopdf
 destination="usage_example.pdf" overwrite="yes"
 source="http://www.google.com/"
 unit="in" pageheight="8" pagewidth="4"
 pagetype="custom">
</cfhtmltopdf>

examples.title: Set Margins
examples.code:
<cfhtmltopdf destination="usage_example2.pdf"
 source="http://www.google.com" overwrite="true" 
 orientation="portrait" pagetype="A4" margintop="1" marginbottom="1" 
 marginleft="1" marginright="1">
</cfhtmltopdf>

examples.title: Protect PDF
examples.code:
<cfhtmltopdf destination="usage_example3.pdf " 
 source="http://www.google.com" overwrite="true"
 orientation="portrait" pagetype="A4" margintop="1" marginbottom="1"
 marginleft="1" marginright="1" ownerpassword="owner" userpassword="user"
 encryption="RC4_128" permissions="AllowPrinting,AllowCopy">
</cfhtmltopdf>
